verbose_text: Furthermore, because loop E is part of the binding site of at least two proteins - transcription factor IIIA that activates 5S rRNA transcription, and the ribosomal protein L5 implicated in post-transcriptional delivery of this RNA from the nucleoplasm to the nucleolus - the possibility that loop E could also act in PSTVd as a binding site for recruiting proteins involved in its replication and/or intranuclear transport was advanced.
evidence: transcription factor IIIA that activates 5S rRNA transcription
